panels.description: Shows the role of the selected member instance (PRIMARY or SECONDARY)
panels.title: ReplSet State

panels.description: Shows the number of members in the replica set
panels.title: ReplSet Members

panels.description: Shows how long ago the last election occurred
panels.title: ReplSet Last Election

panels.description: Shows the current replication lag for the selected member
panels.title: ReplSet Lag

panels.description: Shows the storage engine used on the instance
panels.title: Storage Engine

panels.description: Shows the time range in the oplog and the oldest backed up operation.
panels.title: Oplog Recovery Window

panels.description: Shows the delay between an operation occurring on the primary and that same operation getting applied on the selected member
panels.title: Replication Lag

panels.description: Elections happen when a primary becomes unavailable. Look at this graph over longer periods (weeks or months) to determine patterns and correlate elections with other events.
panels.title: Elections

panels.description: Shows how long various members were in PRIMARY and SECONDARY roles
panels.title: Member State Uptime

panels.description: Shows the heartbeat return times sent by the current member to other members in the replica set.
panels.title: Max Heartbeat Time

panels.description: This can show a correlation with the replication lag value
panels.title: Max Member Ping Time
